entries.content:
Moti introduced himself and provided comprehensive project context:
- Project: Semantix VS Code extension
- Goal: Transform terminal-based Qwen Code into visual, collaborative pair programming experience
- Key features: real-time streaming, permission system, designer controls, multi-state architecture, semantic memory
- Recent fix: permission dialog bug
- Moti prefers emoji usage when appropriate
- Three memory types available: Semantic Memory (long-term), Notebook (session notes), Delta Memories (achievements)

Console log cleanup completed successfully:
✅ Removed 5 debug console.log statements from host/logic-manager layer
  - LogicManager.ts: Line 195 (message validation debug)
  - MessageRouter.ts: Lines 169, 180 (payload conversion debug)
  - MessageValidator.ts: Lines 15, 33 (conversion input/output debug)
✅ Converted activation.ts console.log to proper Logger.info with LogCategory.LIFECYCLE
✅ Verified permission system is clean:
  - 0 console.log statements in permission files
  - 4 critical logger.error statements preserved in PermissionWorkflowManager.ts
  - All permission tracking logs intact for Moti's debugging needs
Result: Clean console for tracking permission logs
